name: Roasted Winter Squash Seeds
author: Blancheskid
summary: Pumpkins aren't the only squash that yield tasty seeds for roasting! Next time you prepare butternut or acorn squash save the seeds and have yourself a nutritious little snack.
ingredients: ½ teaspoon salt, or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil
After removing the seeds from the squash, rinse with water, and remove any strings and bits of squash
Pat dry, and place in a small bowl
Stir the olive oil and salt into the seeds until evenly coated
Spread out in an even layer on the prepared baking sheet
Bake for 15 minutes, or until seeds start to pop
Remove from oven and cool on the baking sheet before serving
